name: Bread sauce

description: This tomato jam is like a grown up version of tomato ketchup, but so much better! Great for using up a tomato glut and a lovely homemade present too, with some cheese and biscuits.

name: Homemade Irish cream
description: Homemade Irish cream is a real treat, served it chilled with plenty of ice or sneak a drop into your coffee.

name: Fondant fancies
ingredients: green, pink and yellow food colouring
description: These miniature cakes are perfect for a posh afternoon tea.

name: Union Jack fondant fancies
description: Give your Royal Wedding party a patriotic feel with these cute fondant fancies.

name: Red velvet cake
description: Try our recipe for a classic red velvet cake with cream cheese icing.

name: Union Jack battenberg cake
description: This cake takes time and concentration, but is well worth the effort!

name: Blueberry and lemon traybake
description: This fruity traybake is so good, you won't be able to stop at one piece!

name: Beef stir-fry
ingredients: 1 tsp rice wine or dry sherry
225g/8oz Chinese flowering cabbage or pak choi
2 tbsp Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
1 tbsp whole yellow bean sauce, from a jar
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
description: Stir-fried beef with rich black bean sauce and noodles - who can even think of phoning the takeaway?

name: Healthy mini pizzas
description: A wheat-free pizza with three delicious flavour combinations to choose from. The pizza toppings ingredients below are per mini pizza, so double or quadruple the ingredients, as necessary.

name: Penne with anchovy, broccoli, chilli and garlic
description: Don’t waste the flavoursome oil in your tin of anchovies. Here it’s used to cook the garlic and chilli ahead of adding pasta and broccoli to the pan.

name: Sausage and butterbean casserole with herby crumb topping
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Sausages, tinned beans and tomatoes are a classic combo for a cheap and flavoursome casserole. With its crunchy parsley topping, this version of sausage stew is super-irresistible.

name: Moroccan grilled chicken with preserved lemon
ingredients: 1 preserved lemon, washed and chopped, skin and pith only
description: Barbecued chicken is a perennial summer favourite, and this Moroccan take with preserved lemon is sure to please.

name: Vegetarian curry with Indian cheese, tomatoes and peppers (paneer jalfrezi)
description: According to a poll featured in the British Curry Club’s in-house magazine, the jalfrezi is now the most popular choice in Britain’s Indian restaurants. In many Indian restaurants, however, they list ‘jalfrezi’, ‘rogan josh’, ‘dopiaza’, and then simply change the main ingredient from mutton to chicken to vegetable, so you get the impression it’s always the same sauce. This jalfrezi is specifically for paneer, the Indian cheese, and is little more than a stir-fry, which is perfect for the main ingredient.

name: Slow-cooked vegetables
ingredients: and freshly ground sea saltblack pepper
description: Use any vegetables you like for this dish. Here Raymond Blanc uses fennel, red onion, violet artichokes, chicory and plenty of garlic cooked slowly to extract the sugars, giving a wonderful flavour and a soft melting texture.

name: Gold millionaire shortbreads
description: Everyone's a winner with these easy millionaire shortbread gold medal biscuits. Butter fudge makes a great cheat's caramel.

name: Potato bread (Kartoffelbrot)
ingredients: (or 100g/3½oz strong wholemeal flour and 200g/7oz strong white flour)
description: This is a deliciously moist, soft bread, which is perfect with white asparagus soup. It really is a multi-purpose bread and great for sandwiches or fried.

name: Tuna Niçoise wrap
ingredients: 1 x 185g/6½oz can tuna in spring water
description: We made these protein-packed wraps to take on a picnic and they were substantial and tasty – a feast in a flatbread. They survived the journey in a bicycle pannier well too, so just the thing for a day out in the hills and dales.

name: Coffee and walnut cake
ingredients: 1 tbsp instant coffee powder, dissolved in 2 tbsp boiling water
description: A classic combination, given a twist by the addition of a coffee-flavoured cream filling. Sublime.

name: Salt-crusted sea bass with runner bean salad
description: Sea bass baked in salt crust makes for beautifully moist fish. Serve it with a simple summery salad.

name: Chicken and rosewater biryani
description: The rice in a biryani should be so dry and fluffy that when you throw a handful on the floor, all the grains should separate. The secret is to parboil the rice so that the surface is soft and cooked but the centre is still hard, and also to make sure that the main ingredient, i.e. the chicken, mutton, seafood or vegetables, is intensely flavoured but not surrounded by too much ‘gravy’, which will make the rice soggy when the final cooking in a sealed pot takes place.

name: Dry curry of cabbage, carrot and coconut (Thoran)
ingredients: ½ tsp coarsely ground black pepper
250g/9oz hispi or pointed spring cabbage (or spring greens
description: Thoran is a dry vegetable curry from Kerala made from whatever fresh vegetables are around – snake beans, unripe jack fruit, sag (leafy vegetables), even green tomatoes.

name: Chicken with morels and a sherry wine sauce
ingredients: and freshly ground sea saltblack pepper
description: Dried morel mushrooms have a more pronounced flavour than fresh, and they are now available in good supermarkets. This easy chicken recipe sings with their earthy flavours and would go perfectly with a dry Jura white wine.

name: Key lime and elderflower pie
description: An easy twist on the classic key lime pie, this make-ahead dessert has a wonderfully summery taste all year-round.

name: Falafel burger with hummus
ingredients: or fries, or sautéed potatoes salad
description: Shape your falafel mixture into large patties to create a great vegetarian burger. Top with lashings of hummus.

name: Roast beetroot with goats’ cheese
description: Beetroot is roasted ‘en papillote’ here, which means it’s packed into a neat package of foil or parchment before being roasted in the oven. The juices are saved for the dressing, which goes beautifully with breadcrumbed French goats’ cheese.

name: Pot roast pheasant with sweetcorn mash
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
1.2kg/2lb 11oz large baking potatoes, baked until cooked through
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Pot-roasting pheasant keeps it deliciously moist. Potato and sweetcorn mash makes the perfect accompaniment.

name: Crumbed lamb steak with swede mash
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Lamb steak grilled in crunchy breadcrumbs flavoured with parmesan and mustard. Serve with buttery swede mash.

name: Raymond Blanc’s baked cheese “fondue”
ingredients: 2 boxes soft cheese, such as Mont D’or, camembert
description: Raymond Blanc offers two alternative baked melting cheeses – one spiked with chilli, garlic and rosemary and the other topped with a secret ingredient… Lush with homemade flatbread.

name: Salt-baked leg of lamb with salsa verde
description: Baking the lamb, rather than roasting, gives it a different texture and taste. Cooking on the bone stops the muscles in the leg retracting and squeezing out the moisture, and combined with the effects of the steam generated inside the salt crust, and the salt absorbed during cooking, this lamb is incredibly moist and tender. Serve with salsa verde, or mint sauce if you prefer.

name: Sea bream with a courgette salad with fresh mint and rocket
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Mediterranean flavours pack in punch here and would work just as well with sea bass or tuna.

name: Lamb vindaloo
description: Lovers of hot curry will devour this vindaloo. Have yoghurt at the ready and some good naan bread.

name: Egg, bacon and asparagus flan
description: A light tart that melts in the mouth, this feels like a real treat and it’s a cinch to make. There’s not even any rolling involved. If you like, leave asparagus out of the filling mixture or add extra ingredients of your own. Sautéed mushrooms, blanched broccoli and roasted peppers all work well.

name: Nigel Slater's Thai green curry
ingredients: 6 medium-hot green chillies, seeded and chopped
400ml/14 fl oz homemade or ready-made chicken stock
leaves from a large bunch (about 20g/0.7oz) basil
description: The succulent chicken in Nigel Slater’s Thai green curry absorbs the exotic fresh flavours of the other ingredients.

name: Orange and almond cake
description: This orange cake is deliciously moist. Serve it with a dollop of basil cream for a tasty dessert.

name: Chilli-glazed sticky ribs
description: This easy recipe for sticky ribs with fluffy jacket potatoes is American comfort food at its best. Serve with coleslaw, green salad and onion rings.

name: Nasi goreng with lime and sugar barbecued chicken
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Rick Stein serves up tasty Indonesian fried rice - ideal for barbecues, or for using up leftover cooked meat and veg.

name: Homemade minestrone
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Cherry clafoutis
description: Raymond Blanc shares his simple recipe for a classic clafoutis. Other stone fruits would also work well in this dish. Try peaches, plums or apricots.

name: Grilled aubergine salad
description: This simple dish of barbecued aubergine is dressed with chilli, chickpeas, feta and mint.

name: Spatchcock chicken with celeriac remoulade
description: Spatchcocking (flattening) chicken is a handy way of cooking it much quicker than normal. Although you should give this marinade a night in the fridge to really penetrate the meat.

name: Pork chop “Maman Blanc” with sauté potatoes
ingredients: 4 medium potatoes (preferably Maris Piper or King Edward
description: The best meat in the world, cooked the way my mother would do it. She understood an important basic technique of pan-frying meat in such a way that you can create the most delectable juices with a simple medium – water.

name: Sweet and tangy chilli beef
ingredients: 1 tsp Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
description: This delicious beef salad is healthy and quick to prepare - perfect for a midweek supper.

name: Ricotta dumplings
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: These little dumplings, made from a few staple Italian larder ingredients, are traditionally made in my home village of Minori on the feast day of the town’s patron saint.

name: Mary's lemon meringue pie
description: Mary Berry shows you how to make an easy lemon meringue pie with no soggy bottoms in sight.

name: Sachertorte
description: This chocolate cake is said to be invented in Vienna by the chef Franz Sacher in 1832. It improves if left a day or two before cutting

name: Chocolate ripple cheesecake
description: Add a swirl of cocoa to this classic baked American cheesecake from Mary Berry

name: Homemade tandoori chicken
description: Tempt your taste buds with a hot and juicy tandoori chicken recipe, served with a cooling dip.

name: Nigel's adaptable bean soup
ingredients: a few large handfuls of pre-cooked cannellini beans
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: A budget-friendly soup that's healthy and filling.

name: Plum clafoutis
description: Halved plums are covered in a light batter and then baked in the oven to make this traditional French dessert. British plums are at their best in September, so make the most of them then and try this simple pud.

name: Artichoke pasta
ingredients: shavings, to serve (or similar vegetarian hard cheese) parmesan
description: A delightfully simple recipe, ideal for a weeknight supper. Use fresh herbs to get the best flavours and complement the artichokes.

name: Basic tomato and basil sauce for pasta
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This is a really easy pasta sauce recipe - vary the flavour by adding different ingredients (see Top recipe tip below).

name: Scary Halloween cookies
ingredients: red, white and black writing icing
description: Try colouring the cookie dough with black or red food colouring; it may not be pretty but it will be scary.

name: Parmesan and poppy seed lollipops
description: Put away those toasted nuts and crisps says Lorraine Pascale... Canapés have reached a whole new dimension!

name: Wholemeal cheese scones
description: These simple cheese scones are a doddle to make and full of flavour - great for taking on a picnic.

name: Pulled pork with cinnamon and clove
ingredients: leaves, cleaned and well drained, to serve Little Gem lettuce
description: The Goan version of pulled pork is a meal for times of celebration. Serve it in lettuce cups with spicy coleslaw.

name: Intense chocolate cookies
description: Often I make a full batch of these but bake only half and freeze the other half. I freeze them on a little tray and once they're hard, I bung them in a freezer bag and stash it back in the freezer. That way I can bake another six without any effort.

name: Angel food cake with lemon curd
description: This American cake is incredibly light as it’s made with whisked egg whites and no fat. Mary Berry decorates her version with homemade lemon curd and passion fruit seeds.

name: Lamb stew with black pepper, coconut and clove
ingredients: 2 tbsp rapeseed oil or vegetable oil
description: This subtle, mellow stew is often cooked in Indian people’s homes and is great for the whole family. It shows how simple dishes of European origin have been adapted and adopted into the cuisine of the subcontinent. As an alternative to lamb, I urge you to try mutton – ask your butcher to source meat approved by the Mutton Renaissance Club. The dish can be easily cooked in a pressure cooker or in the oven, while you get on with life – adjust the timings accordingly.

name: Exceptional gammon with cider and cinnamon
ingredients: sautéed red cabbage with cumin seeds and lemon juice
description: Gammon and coriander seeds have a time-honoured partnership, and have long been used to preserve meat. Our visit to a cider barn in Somerset inspired us to add some additional flavours. Using both cider and apple juice, and adding a bite of red chilli to the flavour of the  coriander seeds adds a real sparkle to this dish.

name: English muffins
ingredients: 300g/10½ oz strong white bread flour, plus extra for flouring
description: Once you’ve made your own English muffins, you’ll never want to buy them again. Factor in a couple of hours proving time to get Paul Hollywood’s easy version ready to go on the griddle.

name: Basque chicken pie
description: Some say that Basque food is the best in Spain and if this top-notch pie is anything to go by, they’re right! This is like having a flamenco danced on your tongue.

name: Chicken quesadillas and sweetcorn salsa
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Use up leftover roast chicken in James Martin's family-friendly quesadillas.

name: Floating islands with spun sugar
description: A classy, dreamy dessert of poached meringues floating on a sea of creamy custard, decorated with a ball of spun sugar.

name: My mother’s cheese and onion pie
ingredients: salt and freshly ground white pepper
description: Make time for a lazy afternoon of cooking with Simon Hopkinson’s homemade cheese and onion pie recipe.

name: Scottish cranachan with a wee twist
description: Originally, the traditional Scottish cranachan celebrated the harvest, but now it is enjoyed year-round. There are many variations, but in all of them the trick is the slow toasting of the oatmeal; this is then mixed into the dish at the last minute so that its texture is retained. The quantities given here for the cardamom honey make a full jar, much more than you need for this amount of cranachan, but it will keep indefinitely; it is great over granola and in coffee.

name: Splendidly spicy beef burger
ingredients: 1 tbsp rapeseed oil or vegetable oil
description: A wonderful burger that shows what can result from thinking just a little bit differently. Choose the best-quality lean meat you can, be brave and have fun experimenting with combinations of ingredients.

name: Strawberry pavlova
description: Crunchy, chewy, creamy and sweet this candy pink strawberry pavlova is fit for a princess.

name: Egg custard tarts
description: The slightly nutty short-crust pastry makes the perfect crumbly case for a rich egg custard topped with nutmeg. Go on have another!

name: Piedmontese peppers
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Explore Mediterranean flavours with Simon Hopkinson's recipe for roast peppers – perfect for antipasto or a light lunch.

name: Tuiles with chocolate mousse
description: Mary Berry’s recipe for tuiles shapes these French wafer biscuits in three ways – decorated curves, chocolate-dipped cigars and a basket that can be filled with chocolate mousse.

name: Mary’s tarte tatin
ingredients: finely grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
description: This classic ‘upside down’ French tart, usually served warm as a pudding.

name: Apricot couronne
description: Make teatime special with this sweet, glazed crown of rich bread stuffed with apricots, walnuts and raisins.

name: Pollack, chorizo and chickpea stew
description: A one-pot dish that's easy to prepare and serve a crowd. Pollack is a cheaper variety of white fish and is perfect for poaching in the flavourful stew.

name: Fondant potatoes
ingredients: sea salt flakes and freshly ground black pepper
description: Sounds awfully posh, doesn't it? But these potatoes are really a easy and luxurious side dish to a roast or steak.

name: Liver and bacon with onions and gravy
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: The Hairy Bikers’ traditional liver and bacon makes a simple supper packed full of flavour and bursting with vitamins and minerals

name: Pork, chorizo and butter bean stew
ingredients: 1 bird's-eye chilli, seeds removed, flesh chopped
description: A real rib-sticker, this stew. Slow down and extend the cooking time (adding liquid if necessary) if you like it really tender.

name: Trout croquettes
ingredients: 1 x 450g/1lb fresh brown or rainbow trout
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Roast shoulder of lamb with herbs and honey
ingredients: handful dried camomile (or contents of 4 camomile teabags)
salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tbsp good Greek or wild flower clear honey
description: Forget about carving this easy slow-cooked pot roast – pull the fragrant, tender lamb from the bone, rustic style.

name: Pearl barley with spinach and pork mince
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This is a filling pork and spinach orzotto - like a risotto, but with pearl barley instead of rice.

name: Courgette fritters with bloody Mary tomatoes
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Make the most of courgettes with this delicious recipe for fritters.

name: Religieuse
description: Impress with this traditional French pastry made up of two choux buns filled with pastry cream, topped with chocolate ganache and decorated with a whipped cream ‘collar’.

name: Focaccia
description: This focaccia recipe is easy to make and easy to adapt. Try adding herbs such as rosemary or thyme, or perhaps some chopped chilli.

name: Warm tomato and onion salad with a beef dressing and sourdough croûtons
description: This substantial salad is a British take on the Italian panzanella. Don't be put off by the beef dripping - the salad's strong flavours need a dressing with some oomph to stand up to them.

name: Tom's fried chicken in a basket
description: Fried chicken with spicy smoky kick - serve it in a basket with coleslaw for a touch of nostalgia.

name: Canary Mary
description: Pep up a bloody Mary recipe with a burst of fresh ginger.

name: Homemade fish fingers
ingredients: 500g/1lb2oz thick skinless fish fillets ( salmoncodhaddockwhite fish
description: The Hairy Bikers share their simple homemade version of this tea time family favourite dish. Serve with tomato ketchup and plenty of bread and butter.

name: Bengali butternut squash with chickpeas
ingredients: ½ tsp panch phoran (a blend of equal quantities of fenugreek, nigella seeds, fennel seeds, cumin and mustard seeds

name: Multi-seeded wheat-free loaf
ingredients: 450g/1lb wheat-free flour (a blend of potato flour, rice flour, tapioca flour and xanthan gum)
2 free-range eggs, plus 1 free-range egg beaten for egg wash
4 tbsp mixed seeds, such as pumpkin, sesame and sunflower seeds
description: It’s always handy to have a decent wheat-free loaf up your sleeve, and this one made with a variety of seeds is a winner. Try it with butter curls and Cheddar.

name: Toad in the hole
ingredients: 8 good quality pork, beef or vegetarian sausages

name: Hazelnut dacquoise
description: Seriously impress with this fancy French dessert of layers of hazelnut meringue, hazelnut praline, chocolate ganache and a coffee custard filling.

name: Gin and tonic granita
description: This light, and slightly boozy dessert is the perfect way to finish a heavy meal. The apple caramel adds a sweetness to an otherwise sharp, refreshing dish.

name: Roast monkfish with cumin and coriander spice and a baked aubergine purée
description: This is a very simple recipe with a piece of lightly spiced monkfish on a bed of aubergine purée served with a sharp, slightly spicy dressing.

name: Mulligatawny soup
ingredients: or flat-leaf parsley, to garnish (optional) fresh coriander
description: A richly flavoured soup, spiced with curry powder. Perfect for a cold day, serve with a dollop of tangy sour cream.

name: Mince and dumplings
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Embrace autumn with a great, big hug of a dish: comforting mince and dumplings.

name: Moussaka
ingredients: ½ tsp flaked sea salt, plus extra for seasoning
and freshly ground sea saltblack pepper
description: A good moussaka is a joy to behold with cinnamon spiced lamb mingling with aubergines and a delicious creamy sauce.

name: The ultimate fish pie
description: This posh fish pie combines smoked haddock, salmon and prawns, homemade parsley sauce and a cheesy mashed potato topping.

name: Pork belly with apples and sage
description: The Hairy Bikers recipe for the ultimate roast pork belly is great for a Sunday lunch or dinner party.

name: Sticky toffee apple pudding with calvados caramel sauce
description: James Martin’s wickedly indulgent sticky toffee pudding is flavoured with apple and topped with a boozy caramel sauce.

name: Perfect roast pork belly with cabbage and bacon
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: James Martin’s twice-cooked pork belly comes with bacon-flecked greens and a fluffy apple sauce.

name: Chocolate tart with white chocolate sauce
description: A superbly rich chocolate tart served with a sweet white chocolate sauce and raspberries. A brilliant make-ahead dinner party dessert.

name: Chicken jalfrezi
ingredients: , cooked according to packet instructions basmati rice
description: Chicken jalfrezi is up there as a curry house favourite and this version by Simon Rimmer shows it’s as easy as anything to make at home.

name: Pork and fennel casserole
description: Unwind with a Mediterranean-flavoured casserole of pork, chorizo and fennel.

name: Chocolate macaroons
description: Raymond Blanc reveals the secrets to the perfect macaroon, one of the benchmarks by which a good patisserie is measured. You may need a little practice to get them right but, as M Blanc says, “every mistake will still be delicious. Trust me; I know!”

name: Roasted butternut squash and sage risotto with pinenuts
ingredients: flaked sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
400g/14oz arborio or other Italian risotto rice
1 litre/1¾ pint hot chicken or vegetable stock
good handful of freshly grated parmesan
description: Butternut squash and sage is a marriage made in heaven as this simple yet flavour-packed risotto shows.

name: Koli ishtew (chicken stew)
description: This delicious spicy chicken dish is packed with fresh Indian flavours such as mace, curry leaves and other spices.

name: Chicken with rice (arroz con pollo)
ingredients: 1 roast chicken carcass, meat removed, or setrippd chicken leg
250g/9oz ripe tomatoes, preferably on the vine, chopped
1½-2 limes, plus 1 extra lime, cut into wedges, to serve
description: This fabulous Spanish-inspired recipe is a handy way to use up the carcass and leftover meat from a roast chicken.

name: Bonfire toffee
description: A real British classic, this jaw-breaking treacle toffee dates back hundreds of years and is really easy to make.  You will need a candy thermometer, preferably a digital one.

name: Charlotte royale
description: This kitsch dessert is made up of jam-filled Swiss roll with a set egg custard flavoured with raspberries, strawberries and raspberry liqueur.

name: Pork fillet stroganoff
description: Pork fillet is a really tender cut so great for quick-cook dishes like Mary's creamy stroganoff.

name: Pork belly with lentils and black cabbage salsa
description: Pork belly is a fantastic and relatively inexpensive cut of meat. The generous covering of fat gives great flavour, brilliant crackling and prevents the meat drying out. Tom serves his with a fresh salsa to cut through the richness of the dish and lentils to provide substance.

name: Pretzels
description: The technique for shaping pretzels is tricky, but once you’ve got the hang of it you’ll return to this recipe time and again. There’s enough dough for six sweet orange and poppy seed pretzels and six savoury salted pretzels.

name: Breast of lamb baked with onions
ingredients: fine salt and freshly ground white pepper
description: Simon Hopkinson’s slow-cooked lamb marries French technique with English soul for a tempting family dish.

name: Lemon posset with fennel biscotti
description: Three simple ingredients is all it takes to make a posset, a wonderfully light dessert to serve at the end of a hefty Sunday roast.

name: Treacle-cured beef with Yorkshire puddings and roast potatoes
description: Tom's twist on one of the nation's favourite dishes. This dish requires requires a 24 hour marinade - but it will be well worth it.

name: Opera cake
description: A joconde sponge is a decorative almond-flavored sponge cake made in layers. Opéra gâteau is an elaborate version of it, here made with kirsch syrup and a chocolate ganache.

name: Ginger and treacle spiced traybake
description: Make this traybake in advance and you can freeze it before adding the icing - in fact freezing improves the taste.

name: Wobbly apricot tart
description: The pastry and marzipan melt over the apricot halves to make a wobbly top for this sweet, and simply delicious, fruit tart.

name: Cheese and herb muffin in a mug
description: This super-quick muffin is cooked in the microwave – believe it when you see it! It’s a tasty savoury muffin that’s perfect for a snack, or great with soup.

name: Spicy Mexican bean soup
ingredients: 2 medium carrots or 1 medium carrot and 1 medium sweet potato
description: This hearty, warming soup uses basic store cupboard ingredients and is cooked from scratch in the microwave. Add extra chilli powder for a spicy kick.

name: Chicken with tomato sauce
description: This quick and easy one-pot dish - all cooked in the microwave - is perfect for a midweek meal and is delicious with a jacket potato, pasta or rice and a green salad.

name: Microwave spaghetti bolognese
description: Bolognese sauce is one of those recipes that everyone should learn to cook. It can be adapted to make lasagne, chilli con carne or even cottage pie and you can add extra vegetables such as mushrooms and peppers to use up whatever you have in the fridge.

name: Poached salmon with lemon sauce
description: Fish can be cooked really easily and quickly in a microwave and doesn’t leave a fishy smell in your kitchen. Using store cupboard ingredients you can create a lovely sauce to pour over the fish in no time at all. Serve with some boiled potatoes and green vegetables.

name: Rye bread
description: Black treacle adds a rich sweetness to this rye loaf. Perfect for posh picnic sandwiches.

name: Olive breadsticks
ingredients: 1kg/2lb 2oz strong white bread flour, plus extra for dusting
description: These pencil-thin sticks studded with green olives are great served with olive oil or your favourite dips for a party.

name: Brioches à tête
ingredients: 6 free-range eggs, one egg beaten for egg wash
description: Brioche à tête (or parisienne) is a brioche baked into a fluted round tin with a ball of dough placed on top to form the ‘head’, the tête. Great for brunch with a strong coffee.

name: Spanakopita
description: You can save yourself the effort and use shop-bought filo pastry for this savoury Greek pastry. But once you’ve mastered the technique you’ll want to return to this delicious vegetarian recipe time and time again.

name: Apple and toffee crumble pie
description: If you can’t decide between apple crumble or apple pie this is the recipe for you. Tom’s pie has a pastry bottom, crumble top and a fruit filling laced with homemade treacle toffee which melts as it cooks.

name: Proper baked beans with soda bread toast
ingredients: 400g/14oz dried white beans (such as haricot blanc), soaked overnight in cold water
description: Beans on toast is a British staple, but you can very easily make it something special. Don't be put off by the long cooking time - it's just a few minutes of effort and the rest of the time it takes care of itself.

name: Irish soda bread
description: Try this easy soda bread recipe for when you want bread in a hurry - it's ready in less than an hour.

name: Coq au vin
description: Try James Martin's version of this French classic. Serve with olive oil mash or good bread.

name: Mary Berry’s tipsy trifle
description: Homemade Swiss roll and soaks up the sherry and adds a special decorative touch to this party-time mega-trifle.

name: Soda bread
description: Soda bread is perhaps the easiest bread to make by hand - with little kneading and no waiting around for it to rise. Treacle gives it an earthy taste, darkens the crumb and crisps up the crust.

name: Individual fruit pies
description: These little pies are filled with a luscious fruity mix, spiked with a little alcohol. They remind me of the fruit pies my Nan used to make: a real treat, especially when served warm with whipped cream. I’ve given you three fillings to choose from; each uses the full quantity of pastry.

name: Toffee apple cake
description: A dash of cinnamon and chewy toffee make this moist apple cake really special. Great served as a dessert with custard or in slices with a cup of something hot.

name: Deconstructed cream tea
ingredients: 1 free-range egg, beaten for egg wash
description: Paul serves his scones in fingers with a homemade strawberry and champagne compôte for a modern take on this British classic.

name: Gypsy tart
description: Muscovado sugar lends a rich caramel flavour to this unique, very sweet tart. Serve with a little crème fraîche or plain yoghurt to balance the sweetness.

name: Blueberry and buttermilk panna cotta
description: This dessert dish of rich buttermilk panna cotta studded with jewels of blueberries and a blueberry sauce is a great make-ahead pud.

name: Pumpkin and ginger cheesecake
ingredients: 3 tbsp ginger syrup (from a jar of stem ginger
description: Turn leftover pumpkin pulp into a delicious dessert with these individual no-bake cheesecakes.

name: Cobnut, pear and sticky toffee tart
description: Kentish cobs are cultivated hazelnuts, often larger than the wild variety, and easier to gather. Crunchy and sweet, they partner apples and pears perfectly in this autumnal, nutty, treacly tart.

name: Meat and potato pie
description: This is one of my favourite pies: a great, no-nonsense recipe that does exactly what it says on the tin, and is all the better for it. I use chuck steak (also known as braising steak), which has lots of flavour, and two types of potato: a floury variety, which falls apart and thickens the gravy, and a waxier type that holds its shape to provide texture.

name: Luxury fish pie
description: A fish pie, I think, always needs a bit of smoked fish to really make it taste good and what could be more luxurious than smoked Scottish langoustines? If you can’t get hold of any, use giant tiger prawns instead, and replace half of the plain haddock with smoked haddock.

name: Scouse pie
description: Scouse is a type of thrifty meat stew, in this case made with lamb. Here Liverpool’s finest stew is topped with a layer of puff pastry to make a homely pie.

name: Thai chicken pie
description: I love a good Thai chicken curry, fragrant with spices, chilli and ginger, and creamy with coconut milk. This is my pastry-topped tribute to that dish.

name: Corned beef plate pie
ingredients: splash Hendersons Relish or Worcestershire sauce
description: This double-crusted pie may have an old-fashioned thrifty feel, but it’s ideal for a family supper, and very easy to put together. Use good-quality tinned corned beef for the best flavour and choose a reasonably waxy potato variety such as Desiree, that will hold its shape in the pie, giving a good texture.

name: Salted caramel and coffee éclairs
description: These grown-up éclairs are very straightforward and will have you wowing family and friends.

name: Lardy cake crown
description: All the rich, indulgent flavours of lardy cake packed into a soft enriched dough, that's twisted to make a crown fit to grace any table.

name: Lemon and lavender loaf cake
description: This is such a simple cake - a variation on the classic lemon drizzle - and it works a treat. It has a wonderful, light texture, a very fresh taste and it looks incredibly pretty – perfect with a cuppa on a sunny afternoon.

name: Chocolate and prune tart
description: The combination of prunes, chocolate and brandy rarely fails to please and this deliciously dark and sophisticated tart uses cocoa pastry for an extra chocolate hit.

name: Coffee crème caramels
description: These are very sophisticated puds with the sweetness of the custard balanced by the flavour of coffee and a touch of bitterness from the caramel. You need to make these a day in advance so they can sit in the fridge, where the caramel will gradually melt into the coffee custard.

name: Beetroot pie
description: This recipe is based on the sweet, spicy American pumpkin pie but uses very British beetroot, which gives it an amazing, deep colour and flavour. Serve with crème fraîche.

name: Cumberland rum Nicky
description: This traditional northern treat is a real favourite of mine. It’s stuffed with sticky dates and treacly brown sugar and laced with ginger and rum. ‘Nicky’ may stem from the original technique of covering the filling with a whole piece of pastry then making slashes or ‘nicks’ in it.

name: Spinach, feta and pine nut parcels
description: These triangular pasties are based on a Lebanese speciality called fatayer, and use soft bread dough, rather than pastry, to enclose the filling. I like frozen spinach for this recipe – it’s very easy to use and actually produces a less watery mixture.

name: Raised pork and egg pie
description: I love pies that have the treat of whole eggs hidden inside. This is a picnic classic and a generous slice would be perfect for a lunchbox too. Don’t be daunted by the idea of using hot water crust pastry – the pie is moulded in a tin, which makes it very easy to put together.

name: Chicken and chorizo empanadas
description: Traditional in Spain and Portugal, empanadas are little pastry pockets with an intensely flavoured savoury filling. They are great eaten any time but make a particularly good tapas-style snack with a cold beer.

name: Cheese, potato and onion pie
description: The rich pastry in this cheese pie is very tender and almost melts into the filling beneath. Serve this as a meat-free main course, with some steamed greens or a big bowl of salad.

name: Scotch pies
description: Also known as mutton pies, these have a very long history. In the middle ages, they were frowned upon by the Scottish church, viewed as luxurious, decadent English-style food. In later centuries, they proved to be convenient and sustaining snacks for working people, who would buy them hot from pie-men or pie-wives in the city streets. The space on top of the pie, created by the raised crust, would sometimes be filled with gravy, beans or mashed potato.

name: Shallot, onion and chive tart
description: Three different alliums give this creamy tart a lovely range of savoury flavours, while the grainy mustard adds a note of sweetness. Like most savoury egg tarts, it is best eaten warm or at room temperature, rather than piping hot.

name: Salmon coulibiac
description: This rice, egg and salmon-stuffed fish pie makes a wonderful centre-piece for a dinner party and is easy to make and prepare in advance.

name: Cheese and onion pie
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This stunning vegetarian pie is perfect for a picnic or lunchbox and looks just as at home at the centre of the dinner table.

name: Syrup sponge in the microwave
description: This light, fluffy steamed pudding cooks in just four minutes in the microwave. Serve it with golden syrup, or jam and custard.

name: All-in-one rib roast with horseradish glaze
description: Glazed rib of beef covered with fresh horseradish and beef dripping will not disappoint.

name: Brie brioche pie
description: This pie is made using sweetened bread dough and filled with a rich ham and cheese combo.

name: Cranachan cheesecake
description: The classic Scottish dessert, cranachan, is a delicious blend of toasted oatmeal, raspberries, honey and crowdie - a type of soft, mild cheese. I’ve used those ingredients as the inspiration for this gorgeous cheesecake. Make it in summer or early autumn when British raspberries are at their best. If you can’t get hold of any crowdie, ricotta works equally well.

name: Yorkshire curd tart
description: Curd tarts were traditionally baked for Whitsuntide, when many Yorkshire villages held feasts and fair days. The filling was originally made from ‘beestings’, the first, very rich milk from newly calved cows, though nowadays it’s easier (and just as good) to use curd cheese. Rosewater is a classic flavouring.

name: Apple and blackberry crumble
description: Paul Hollywood adds a twist to the traditional crumble topping with the addition of seeds, oats and shony, a sweet and salty powdered seaweed. Serve with custard, cream or ice cream.

name: Chocolate orange pond pudding
description: This is my take on Sussex pond pudding – the classic suet pud boiled with a whole lemon inside. I use a whole orange instead and add chocolate. The juice from the fruit combines with the melted chocolate, butter and sugar to create an irresistible sauce that floods out as the pudding is cut – hence the title.

name: Bacon and egg pie
description: This is a delicious savoury pie that really makes the most of the winning partnership between egg and pork. I love the way the whole eggs are hidden beneath the crust – if you get one when you cut into it, it’s like winning a prize. Serve this hot for supper or cold for lunch.

name: Goat-herd pie
description: Instead of lamb this recipe uses goat meat for a leaner version of a traditional shepherd’s pie that’s very tasty indeed. You can, of course, still use lamb if you prefer.

name: Lamb and kidney suet pudding with rosemary
description: When it comes to comfort food, you just can’t beat a traditional, steamed suet pudding like this one. It takes a little while to cook but is very simple to put together. Rather than the usual steak, I like to use lamb shoulder, which is full of flavour and complemented wonderfully by a good shot of fresh rosemary.

name: Steak and perfectly cooked chips
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Follow Simon Hopkinson’s simple steps for the perfect steak and homemade chips recipe.

name: Key lime pie
description: You can make this zesty pie in advance and keep it in the fridge until ready to serve.

name: Pear and apricot frangipane tart
description: This recipe uses tinned pears and apricot jam - making it perfect for winter when there's little fresh fruit in season.

name: Marmalade and almond cake
description: This is based on a classic orange polenta cake. However, I find polenta (a type of cornmeal) can have a slightly gritty texture. I now use semolina instead – which is ground from hard durum wheat. It gives a lovely, fine texture to the cake. If you’d prefer to keep the cake wheat-free, use polenta or fine cornmeal instead.

name: Steamed liquorice sponges
description: With these light and fluffy puddings, I was aiming to create a dish informed by some of the sweet-shop flavours of my childhood. Liquorice was the perfect choice – it has a lovely fruity tang that carries beautifully through the sponge. If you think you don’t like liquorice, think again...

name: Apple and Wensleydale pie
description: There’s a saying in Yorkshire that ‘apple pie without cheese is like a kiss without a squeeze’. I couldn’t agree more – tangy, salty cheese and sweet apple go beautifully together. I like to use a mixture of cooking and eating apples in this pie, in order to create a varied, interesting texture.

name: Heather honey sponge
description: There’s nothing to compare to the light, fluffy texture of a steamed sponge pudding. Golden syrup is a classic addition, of course, but I love this version, which makes the most of the fragrant flavour of Scottish heather honey. Any other well-flavoured honey will work well too.

name: Arctic roll
description: This wonderfully retro pud dates back to the 1950s and is a really fun way to round off a dinner party. Serve it just as it is or add fresh raspberries or strawberries.

name: Sausage rolls
description: Sausagemeat mixed with thyme leaves and pickle makes a wonderful filling for sausage rolls. Great for a picnic.

name: Curried cod pasties
ingredients: 2 tsp carom seeds (also known as ajwain seeds)
description: Using chapati dough instead of pastry adds a wholesome flavour to these pasties, as well as an authentic Indian touch.

name: Rabbit and pancetta pot pies
description: I kept rabbits as a child and I was so distraught when a fox ate them, I didn’t eat rabbit until my thirties! I’ve found it makes a great pie filling when combined with a little pancetta, to balance its leanness. Make this warming, hearty dish during autumn and winter when you’ll really appreciate it and rabbit is at its best.

name: Raised game pie
description: A game pie always makes a spectacular centrepiece and this handsome example is amazingly straightforward to make – especially if you buy mixed game meat ready-prepared from a good butcher.

name: Chilli beef cornbread pies
description: Freshly baked cornbread is a great accompaniment to stews and chilli, and this recipe combines the two elements in one golden, bubbling dish. Shin of beef is a very economical cut – it needs a long cook to make it tender, but you’ll be rewarded with a fantastic depth of flavour.

name: Sausage plait
description: This is either a poor man’s Wellington, or a posh sausage roll, depending on how you look at it. It’s certainly good enough for a special meal. The sausage filling is spiked with black pudding, enhanced with a savoury mushroom base and topped with caramelised onions. Wrapped in crisp, buttery ‘plaited’ pastry, it looks really impressive but is easy to make.

name: Classic Christmas cake
description: Mary Berry’s been making her Christmas cake recipe for as long as Paul Hollywood’s been alive. She knows what she’s talking about.

name: Pecan toffee cheesecake
description: This dessert is like a big kiss on the lips. All of the toffee and pecan flavor will have you reaching for another slice.

name: Bacon and egg canapés
ingredients: salt and fresh ground black pepper
description: Delight your party guests with these mini-bacon and egg tartlets, full of flavour and colour.

name: Hot chicken cakes with lettuce and mayo
description: Deeply savoury meatballs with chicken, bacon and parmesan make a great snack with drinks or an incredible sandwich.

name: Turkey salad with Chinese cabbage, beansprouts and Vietnamese mint
ingredients: 15g/½oz Vietnamese mint leaves (available from some Asian grocers), or a mixture of coriander

name: Mincemeat streusel
description: This Christmas traybake is very quick and easy – much faster than making mince pies.   The cooked streusel freezes very well – always serve warm with cream or brandy butter.

name: Reindeer Christmas cupcakes
ingredients: crisp-coated chocolates (such as Smarties or M&Ms)
description: These super-cute Christmas cupcakes are prefect for baking with children.

name: Sun-dried tomato and rosemary palmiers
description: Give Lorraine Pascale’s super-quick canapés or an easy picnic snack a go today.

name: Ginger chocolate oat bar
description: This is a fantastic gluten-free chocolate oat dessert packed with dried cranberries and cherries and the spice kick of crystallised ginger. It’s great in a picnic box too.

name: Sausage Danish
description: Sausage meat is crumbled onto buttery puff pastry and speckled with fennel seeds in this stunning snack, that’s perfect for parties or picnics.

name: Crispy filo mince pies with pear and apple mincemeat
ingredients: a few twists cracked black pepper
, in a spray bottle vegetable oil
1 vanilla pod, seeds scraped out or 1 tsp vanilla extract
description: Try this lighter version of mince pies made with filo pastry and fresh apples and pears. Great for mince pie skeptics.

name: Christmas panna cotta
description: This easy, creamy dessert is less dense than a traditional pudding but still packed with Christmas spices.

name: Scotch eggs
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Homemade Scotch eggs are a world away from shop bought versions. They're worth the effort for a special picnic treat.

name: Sherry trifle
ingredients: 1 packet trifle sponges, broken into 5cm/2in pieces
½ packet of amaretti biscuits or 150g/5oz macaroons or ratafias
description: This traditional trifle recipe couldn't be easier, use ready-made custard and sponge to save time.

name: Christmas carrots
description: A great way to brush up the humble carrot. Star anise adds a touch of Christmas spice to the sweet buttery glaze.

name: Turkey roll with Christmas crumble topping and sage and onion stuffing
description: Dry, tasteless turkey be gone! Tom Kerridge shows you how to make a really moist, flavourful turkey roast with all the trimmings.

name: Golden dough balls with cheese and herbs
description: Dough balls are readily available in supermarkets and make an excellent base for hot canapés.

name: Spiced macadamia nuts
description: These nuts are a just-right combo of spice and sweetness, and are perfect with a glass of something cold.

name: Tartiflette
ingredients: and freshly ground black pepper sea salt
description: Try serving this French-style cheesy potato bake with pickled onions, gherkins and charcuterie.

name: Chocolate profiteroles
description: James Martin's profiteroles are as light as air, topped with chocolate and filled with a delicate orange cream.

name: Stilton-stuffed mushrooms with cranberry relish
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: The oozing centres of these bite-sized stuffed mushrooms make it impossible to stop at just one. Perfect as canapés.

name: Arbroath-smokie cakes with chilli jam
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Arbroath smokies are a special type of smoked haddock and well worth tracking down for these delicious fish cakes.

name: Chocolate Christmas pudding cheesecake
description: Turn to the dark side with a baked chocolate cheesecake studded with spiced Christmas pudding on a bourbon biscuit base.

name: Classic champagne cocktail
description: This decadent cocktail of champagne laced with cognac is perfect for special occasions. Treat yourself this Christmas.

name: The Original Snowball
description: For a festive whisky cocktail, throw together this traditional Christmas snowball.

name: Slow cooker beef hotpot
description: Packed with flavour and meltingly tender beef, try this classic comfort food with steamed rice and greens.

name: Yule log
ingredients: a toy robin or sprig of holly
description: Mary Berry shows you how to make a foolproof Bûche de Noël. It's utterly delicious and a perfect alternative to Christmas pudding!

name: Paul Hollywood’s mince pies
description: These easy deep mince pies with readymade mincemeat are so delicious. No soggy bottoms, please.

name: Fennel and mushroom tartlets
description: These beautiful delicate fennel tartlets make a gorgeous starter or part of a buffet lunch.

name: Pasta with winter ratatouille
ingredients: 200g/7oz sweet potatoes, peeled and cut in wedges
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: James Martin shows you a quick and simple way to serve this ever-popular dish.

name: Red lentil and aubergine moussaka
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
100g/3½oz red lentils, cooked according to packet instructions
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Hearty and delicious, moussaka will warm you up from head to toe. You won't miss the meat in this veggie version.

name: Tarte Tatin
description: Invented by two elderly spinsters, the Tatin sisters, this sensuous dessert is one of Raymond Blanc’s favourites. Combining the pleasures of dark caramel, crisp pastry and the sweet acidity of apples, it deserves to be served with the very best crème fraîche (“full fat, please,” says Raymond) or vanilla ice cream.

name: Haggis, clapshot and whisky sauce
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz floury potatoes, such as Maris Piper or King Edward
sea salt and freshly ground white pepper
sea salt and freshly ground white pepper
description: Celebrate Burns Night with The Hairy Bikers' recipe of haggis, neeps, tatties and whisky sauce.

name: Scotch broth
ingredients: 2 litres/3½ pints cold water or lamb stock
description: Warm up with a classic recipe for Scotch broth from The Hairy Bikers.

name: Instant banana ice cream
description: This easy banana ice cream makes a great healthy dessert for children.

name: Haggis with neeps and tatties
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Goats' cheese cannelloni with cherry tomatoes
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
green salad leaves, dressed with olive oil and balsamic vinegar
description: This baked cannelloni recipe is comfort food heaven. You can prepare it in advance, then pop it into the oven when you’re ready to eat.

name: Duck pancakes with hoisin sauce
ingredients: 8-10 ready-made Chinese-style pancakes (or mini flour torillas), warmed
description: Recreate the classic Chinese restaurant dish with our easy recipe.

name: Potato wedges with rosemary
ingredients: coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Potato wedges are the ultimate easy side dish - just slam them in the oven and forget about them until hunger strikes.

name: Macaroons
description: Beautiful macaroons are one of the current ‘sweet’ crazes. Make a batch, put them in a pretty box tied up with ribbon, and give them to a friend as a dazzling gift.

name: Steamed Cantonese-style fish
ingredients: 1½ tbsp finely shredded fresh root ginger
description: This delicious recipe is healthy and low fat without compromising on flavour.

name: Eccles cakes
description: This recipe takes the humble Eccles cake to another level with sherry-soaked currants, chopped peel and spices.

name: Bakewell tart
description: A true British classic, Bakewell tart is best served slightly warm with a dollop of lightly whipped cream.

name: Basic white rolls
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz unbleached strong white organic bread flour, plus extra for dusting

name: Five-spice roast chicken drumsticks
ingredients: 1 tbsp Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry

name: Doris Grant loaf
ingredients: or oil spray, for oiling vegetable oil
description: This ‘no-need-to-knead bread’ was adapted from a 1940s recipe by healthy-eating evangelist Doris Grant, who believed white flour – and its lack of nutrients – was the enemy. Making bread one day, Doris forgot to knead it. On tasting the loaf, she discovered it had a fair taste and decided never again to bother kneading her bread. The resulting loaf is heavy, but quicker to make than other types of bread.

name: Lemon meringue pie
description: A classic combination of sharp lemon filling and sweet pillowy meringue, this pie is is on our top ten!

name: Stir fried chicken and broccoli with noodles
ingredients: 2 tbsp shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
description: Stir-fries are very flexible - throw in whatever vegetables you like into this easy sweet and savoury chicken supper.

name: Lancashire hotpot
description: The stew can be made in advance and topped with potatoes and baked on the day you want to eat it – perfect for midweek meals.

name: Lamb madras with bombay potatoes
description: Heavenly slow cooked lamb in a rich madras curry with spicy potatoes. A perfect Saturday night.

name: Tomato, mozzarella and basil pizza
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz strong plain flour, plus extra for dusting
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: A beautiful cheese and tomato pizza for two that makes takeaway seem tawdry.

name: Alpine pizza
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz strong plain flour, plus extra for dusting
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Nothing beats making your own pizza dough. Here it’s topped with gruyère and salami for a delicious Alpine taste.

name: Spinach, aubergine and chickpea curry
ingredients: 2 fresh hot green chillies, halved and thinly sliced, seeds
description: This delicious vegetarian curry is packed full of flavour and is ready in less than 30 minutes.

name: Quick vegetable curry
description: If your aubergines are young and small, they may not need salting which makes this dish even quicker to make.

name: Pancakes with chocolate sauce
description: Try James Martin's pancake recipe with a wicked chocolate sauce for Pancake Day.

name: Corned beef and onion pie
description: Corned beef has been a favourite store cupboard staple for generations. Here The Hairy Bikers use it to make a simple, hearty pie.

name: Pomegranate panna cotta with pomegranate and orange caramel
Poached corn-fed chicken with panache of vegetables
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Guinness cupcakes
description: This beetroot and Guinness cupcake recipe is deliciously moist. Perfect for celebrating St. Patrick’s Day.

name: Blood orange tart
ingredients: or custard, to serve double cream

name: Thai fish cakes with a honey and cucumber dip
ingredients: 50g/1¾oz snake beans, sliced thinly (alternatively use French beans
2 birds’-eye chillies, seeds removed (if liked), sliced thinly
description: You can make your own red curry paste if you wish but you can get away with a good-quality bought one. The secret to forming the quite sloppy mixture is wet hands - honest it works. You can use halibut, sea bass, pollock or coley depending on your budget. Delicious served with this salsa-like sauce.

name: Coffee and walnut cake
description: This classic coffee and walnut cake is topped with an easy espresso-infused buttercream icing.

name: Orange butterfly cakes
description: These little fairy cakes are filled with orange curd and topped with icing, and are even nicer than cupcakes.

name: Whole lemon cake with lemon cheesecake icing
description: There are three whole lemons used in the cake, icing and decoration so the flavour is incredibly intense and delicious.

name: Loaf cake with apple and cinnamon
description: This is a lovely moist loaf which I love to serve sliced and buttered - and it’s very quick and simple to make.

name: Chocolate traybake with feather icing
description: A chocolate sponge topped with a milk chocolate icing feathered with white chocolate makes this a great cake to share for a birthday party for the young as they love milk chocolate. Decorate it as you like - try topping it with sweets, chopped chocolate bars, marshmallows or lots and lots of candles! If it’s for a more sophisticated occasion use about 40% cocoa solids dark chocolate.

name: Banana pancakes with streaky bacon
description: The Hairy Bikers’ banana pancakes make a brilliant brunch or simple supper. Omit the bacon if you wish.

name: Thai roast chicken
description: Lemongrass, ginger and chillies add a wonderfully intense flavour and fragrance to roast chicken in this stunningly simple recipe.

name: Pork meatballs with anchovies
ingredients: couple of good handfuls of pork mince
few good glugs of fruity olive oil
enough hot chicken or vegetable stock
description: No one will guess these meatballs contain anchovies - they are deeply savoury with a lift of lemon zest and herbs.

name: Squash and turkey bake
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Nigel Slater swaps traditional shepherd’s pie ingredients for turkey and butternut squash, with delicious results.

name: Sweet sticky spicy ribs with red onion salad
ingredients: 1.5kg/3lb 4oz meaty rack of pork spare ribs
description: These ribs are poached ahead of being roasted in a sweet sticky marinade to make them tender as anything.

name: Cauliflower soup
ingredients: 1 litre/1¾ pints chicken or vegetable stock
description: This rich and creamy cauliflower soup is just the ticket on a chilly day - and it's inexpensive too.

name: Grilled salmon, braised cabbage with bacon and onions
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: A recipe for a meal-in-one that is healthy and tasty.

name: Seafood risotto
description: Impress at a dinner party with Rick Stein’s seafood risotto recipe flavoured with saffron and white wine.

name: Goats’ cheese and tomato lasagne
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: An easy-to-make vegetarian lasagne. Serve with a simple salad and garlic bread.

name: Chickpea and butternut squash casserole
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Make this warming vegetarian supper, topped with potato scones, on a cold winter’s night.

name: Aubergine and bean casserole
ingredients: 2 x 400g/14oz can borlotti or butter beans
description: Balance healthy ingredients beautifully with this vegetarian casserole recipe.

name: Meatballs with tomato sauce
ingredients: 2 tbsp freshly chopped herbs, such as marjoram
salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This is one of those quick, comforting, homemade suppers that should be taken to the sofa with a glass of red wine.

name: Grilled teriyaki chicken with leek and pepper stir fry
ingredients: 100g/3½oz chicken thigh meat, scored with a sharp knife
description: Chicken thighs are more flavourful than breasts, but you can use whatever cut you prefer in this simple meal for one.

name: Dolmades
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Once you get the hang of them, making dolmades (vine leaves stuffed with rice) are easy as anything.

name: Fajitas
description: Veggie fajitas are a fun way to feed the family and making your own is much cheaper than buying the boxed kits.

name: Chocolate and chilli mousse
description: A little chilli adds warmth to chocolate dishes without making them really spicy. Try making it in advance for a dinner party.

name: Spicy sausage pasta
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Italian sausages are usually seasoned with fennel and really add something special to this simple recipe.

name: Penne alla torrese
ingredients: 3 tbsp sun-dried tomato flavoured olive oil
description: Use leftover pasta and few staple ingredients to make a quick and tasty dinner for two.

name: Chicken al limone
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Whip up a lemon butter sauce in next to no time to make something special of simply fried chicken breasts.

name: Sausage and bean casserole
description: This hearty bean stew is full of flavour and very easy to make - perfect for a midweek supper.

name: Chocolate fondant tart
description: This tart looks like something you might have bought from a French patisserie, but it is so easy to make. Serve it gently warmed with a dusting of icing sugar, or top it with chocolate curls, drizzle with melted chocolate or top it with a little whipped cream and fresh summer berries. Or all three.

name: Blue cheese and fig tarts
ingredients: 100g/3½oz creamy blue cheese such as dolcelatteroquefort
description: These are simple to make, yet look so sophisticated, and most of the preparation can be done in advance.

name: Rib-eye steak with Stilton butter
description: A thick juicy steak is a real treat and so easy to cook for a dinner party, but here’s how to cook it without having to disappear to the kitchen at the last minute and fill the room with smoke!

name: Stir fry vegetable phad Thai
ingredients: 3 fresh red chillies (or green ones if you want a hotter dish)
1 tbsp Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
description: Feel free to omit the fish sauce and replace it with light soy sauce for a vegetarian phad Thai.

name: Chocolate and cranberry roulade
description: Feel festive and indulge in this chocolately roulade filled with cranberries and cream.

name: Swiss roll
description: Make sure you add a Swiss roll to your recipe repertoire – it's easy and looks impressive.

name: Easy white bread
description: Don’t imagine a bread machine is a must-have for stress-free baking. With a little effort and barely any kneading, you can conjure up an impressive crusty white loaf.

name: Plum and marzipan tarte tatin
description: This is a cheat’s variation of the classic French tart and makes an impressive pudding to serve in the autumn with lots of cream or ice cream.

name: Three fish pie
ingredients: 750g/1lb 10oz mixture of salmon, smoked haddock and fresh haddock, skinned and cut into cubes
description: A lovely fish pie is always a great dish to make ahead and serve for a big family gathering or even a casual supper party with friends. The white wine and leeks make this pie taste a little more sophisticated than usual, but you can use all milk if you are feeding children.

name: Roasted lamb with rosemary and paprika rub
description: Shoulder of lamb is quite fatty, but that’s what makes the meat so sweet and succulent, and by cooking it for a long time at a low temperature, the meat becomes so tender it just falls off the bone. This is the perfect roast to put in the oven and leave while you are out as it cooks slowly in the oven and you will return to a house full of wonderful aromas and meltingly tender meat. Serve it with fresh mint sauce.

name: Fennel and potato gratin
description: This is the perfect combination of potatoes and vegetables all cooked in one dish for a hearty dinner party or Sunday lunch. It is so tasty I could eat it as a supper on its own!

name: Chocolate and peppermint roulade
description: This roulade was inspired by the nostalgic flavour of after-dinner mints. Bitter dark chocolate and a cool peppermint fondant centre.

name: Coley with tarragon sauce vierge
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: White fish served in a classic sauce vierge made from olive oil, lemon juice, chopped tomatoes and herbs. Simple and sophisticated.

name: Merluza à la Gallega
ingredients: 1 x 15cm/6in pimientos de padron or other tiny green pepperspepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Paprika and chorizo flavour this simple one-pot fish dish from Galicia in Spain. You could try it with cod or haddock instead of hake if you prefer.

name: Marmalade yoghurt cake
description: Yoghurt and orange are a great combination in this moist cake recipe. It will also keep for several days in an airtight container if you can resist eating it all at once!

name: Lemon drizzle cake
description: This lemon drizzle loaf cake is a French teatime favourite that Raymond Blanc has served at his restaurant for the past 25 years.

name: Potato latkes (Potato pancakes)
ingredients: 1kg/2lb 4oz old or baking potatoes, peeled, soaked in cold water until needed
salt and freshly ground white pepper
description: Latkes can be made with any variety of vegetable, but for most people, the potato will always be at the heart of things.

name: Chicken stir-fried with pak choi
ingredients: ½ tsp finely chopped fresh red chilli
description: Stir-fries are a great way to use up small amounts of food in the fridge. Be organised and have all the ingredients ready before you heat the pan, as they will cook very quickly.

name: Kids’ any-fruit cobbler
ingredients: 600g/1lb 5oz fresh, tinned (drained weight) or frozen fruit, such as applespearspeachesblackberriescherriesblueberries
description: This makes a great alternative to traditional crumbles and has the added benefit of being really fun for kids to make. Just choose your fruit and the kids can form the cobbler topping. You can use fresh, frozen or tinned fruit, or a mixture.

name: Kids’ veggie slaw
ingredients: ½ celeriac or kohlrabi (these are very strange-looking vegetables
1 tbsp sunflower, sesame or pumpkin seeds
1 spoonful Greek yoghurt and/or a mixture of yoghurt and mayonnaise
handful fresh herbs such as chives, parsley
description: Graters are fine for children to use but please do supervise them as graters can be really sharp. This sweet and fruity slaw can be served as a salad or you can add some natural yoghurt or a little mayonnaise for more traditional coleslaw to serve with barbecued burgers or chicken.

name: Three easy dips for kids
ingredients: small bunch fresh herbs such as mint, coriander
small bunch herbs, such as mint, coriander
description: Dips are great for sandwich fillings or lunch boxes, or make the combo for picnics and parties. Serve with vegetable sticks, baked potatoes, potato skins, pitta breads or flatbreads. These will keep in the fridge for two days.

name: Fruity fritters
description: Fruit fritters can be served for breakfast or as an after-school snack. Kids can mix the batter and add vegetables or fruits but it is best for an adult to fry the fritters as they get very hot.

name: Kids’ cheese and vegetable frittata
ingredients: 2 tsp olive, sunflower or vegetable oil
1 tbsp chopped fresh herbs such as parsleychives
description: Try making a frittata in the oven - this way the kids can do all of the chopping and mixing before an adult puts it in the oven. You can make mini-frittata in muffin tins, ramekins or small pie dishes. Cold frittata is lovely for picnics or lunch boxes.

name: Veggie crumble
ingredients: About 600g/1lb 5oz mixed vegetables that you like, such as
description: Less bother than a pie, vegetable crumble is a great way to use up what you have in the fridge, cupboard or freezer! You can change the filling with the seasons making green and summery fillings in the spring and summer and heartier root vegetable crumbles in the winter.

name: Kids’ minestrone soup
ingredients: small bunch fresh basil or parsley
description: Italian vegetable soups are light and healthy - kids can do most of the preparation and can help with flavouring the soup. It is best for an adult to do the actual cooking at the hob but kids can watch if they can do this from a safe distance on a stable stool or step.

name: Easy chow mein for kids
description: Young children often like stir-fried vegetables because they are still crunchy - so this is a good dish for trying new ingredients. Chow mein can be served hot as a main meal or cold as a salad.

name: Veggie bean burgers for kids
ingredients: 300g/10½oz cooked, mashed vegetables such as carrotsquashpotatosweet potatoparsnip
1 tbsp sunflower, vegetable or olive oil
description: Shop-bought veggie burgers are often deep-fried and quite expensive. You can make your own versions at home which can be frozen and then oven-cooked from frozen as needed. They can all be served with dips or as a filling for pittas, flatbreads or wraps. It is good to add a vegetable of some kind- mashed squash, carrot or sweet potato work really well- you can mash these from boiled or roasted vegetables.

name: Rich beef and mushroom stew
description: This is a rich and comforting stew that is smart enough to serve for a dinner party. I like to serve it with mashed potatoes or my potatoes dauphinoise and a green vegetable.

name: Chelsea buns
description: Nothing beats a warm, sticky bun fresh from the oven. These are drizzled with icing for an extra naughty treat.

name: Lemon and lavender posset with lavender biscuits
ingredients: 2 tsp lavender (fresh buds and leaves or edible dried lavender)
description: A posset is a very simple pudding that dates back to the middle ages. Some possets can be very heavy on the cream, but I’ve used lemon juice and fragrant lavender to cut the richness.

name: Hollywood’s temptation
ingredients: 500ml/18fl oz whole milk (enough to cover the potatoes
description: This recipe is based on a Swedish gratin-style dish called Janssen’s temptation, which pairs potatoes with sprats or anchovies. I like to use hot-smoked Scottish salmon instead, combining it with thinly sliced potatoes, sweet onions and cream then encasing the whole lot in crisp filo pastry to give a contrasting texture.

name: Spinach, mushroom and ricotta quiche with sautéed spinach
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Cook this gorgeous vegetarian quiche for a special occasion.

name: Quick flatbreads
description: Flatbreads are cooked all over the world from Mexican tortillas to Indian chapatis. They are great served soft, filled with slaw or falafels, or baked until crisp and served with dips, soups or stews.

name: Kid’s customised couscous salad
ingredients: small bunch herbs, such as parsleycoriander
small handful nuts, such as flaked almondspine nutspistachios
small handful dried fruits such as raisinssultanasdried apricots
description: Couscous is easy to prepare and can be used as a base for a healthy salad that can contain whatever veg children choose. Couscous can be served warm as a side dish for stews and curries or cold as a salad - it is perfect cooked the day before for picnics and lunchboxes.

name: Stuffed paratha for kids
ingredients: spices, such as ground cumincinnamoncoriandercurry powder
description: These filled Indian flatbreads are a good way to experiment with spices and flavours - you only need a tiny amount of filling and it is a good way of using leftover mashed potato or cooked vegetables. Parathas can be served alongside a curry or can be eaten with dips as an alternative to sandwiches in picnics or lunchboxes.

name: Easy kid’s fishcakes
ingredients: 200g/7oz cooked fish- use either smoked mackerelsalmon
description: You can make fishcakes from any pre-cooked fish - tinned salmon or tuna or smoked mackerel. You could also bake a salmon or haddock fillet in the oven from fresh or frozen. With cooked fish kids can get their hands on mashing and forming the fishcakes and rolling them in crunchy crumbs. Serve fishcakes with cooked peas or salad and a wedge of lemon in a wrap.

name: Kids' baked potato gnocchi with pesto
ingredients: 2 tbsp finely grated cheese, such as parmesan
1 tbsp chopped fresh herbs such as basilchivesparsley
description: Making your own gnocchi is great fun and a real kids' favourite served with pesto, or simple tomato sauce and some grated cheese. Make sure the sauce is ready before you cook the gnocchi as it needs to be served straight away.

name: Frozen elderflower posset
description: This frozen dessert is so fragrant and so easy to make: the ingredients are just whipped together and frozen and it doesn’t need churning. Serve with summer berries for the perfect summer dessert.

name: Apple crumble with walnuts and sunflower seeds
description: The apples and the nutty topping are cooked separately in Mary Berry’s unusual crumble, producing an exceptional crunch.

name: Lemon hummus
description: If you like the traditional sesame seed flavour of hummus, simply add three tablespoons of tahini paste to the mixture. You could also add four tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves for an aromatic flavour.

name: Roasted vegetables
description: Enjoy these vegetables as part of a sharing platter of nibbles, or serve as a side dish with meat or fish.

name: Cherry tomato and mozzarella salad
description: This delicious salad is made from mozzarella pearls – tiny balls of mozzarella that work well in a salad with small tomatoes and basil.

name: Rosemary-roasted almonds
description: This is a great snack to bring out when the drinks are flowing. The combination of rosemary and smoked paprika makes these nuts especially more-ish.

name: Lamb dhansak
description: Dhansak is a popular Indian curry made from meat, lentils and flavoured with spices including cumin and ginger. It’s mild, sweet and rich with just enough heat to satisfy most tastes. Best of all it benefits from being made a day in advance as it tastes even better re-heated the next day.

name: 15 minute pasta
description: This is my standby pasta supper as it is so delicious, so quick and everyone loves it. Great for everyday or for casual supper parties too.

name: Cottage pie with dauphinoise potato
description: This is the perfect meal to serve when all the family are around as everyone can help themselves to as little or as much as they want. It’s generous enough for second helpings and if by any chance there are leftovers, it tastes great the next day. It’s so much smarter than the usual cottage pie, so is perfect for casual supper parties too.

name: Vegetable garden risotto
ingredients: sea salt flakes and freshly ground black pepper
description: Stir the essential flavours of an English summertime into this delicious, verdant risotto.

name: Chicken tikka masala
ingredients: sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Marinating the meat makes all the difference so don't be tempted to skip that step. If you want a lighter curry, swap some of the cream for natural yoghurt.

name: Mushroom stroganoff
description: Try this quick, creamy and comforting vegetarian casserole with brown or basmati rice.

name: Almond-rolled goats' cheese
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Watercress comes into season in April, when its peppery flavour will work in contrast to the rich goats’ cheese.

name: Chickpea and chorizo stew
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Use tinned chickpeas to make a speedy, spicy, smoky mid-week supper to warm you up from head to toe.

name: Creamy lentil and rice dish (khicheri)
ingredients: 35g/1¼oz mung beans, split and husks removed (or husks left on if using brown rice
400ml/14fl oz water (or 500ml/17fl oz if using brown rice
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
description: Khicheri is made with rice and lentils. I make mine with brown rice and split green lentils, but it is normally made with white rice and can be made with just about any kind of lentil.

name: Roast fillet of beef with roasted garlic and mustard cream
description: A tender cut of beef is a little bit of luxury and this is the perfect main course to cook for a gathering of friends.

name: Griddled halloumi
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Grilled halloumi and marinated courgette ribbons make an easy open sandwich for parties or supper for one.

name: Smothered leeks and kohlrabi
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Smothering is a way of cooking vegetables with a little fat and the least possible amount of water, in a covered pan (I guess that's the smothering bit) until very, very tender. Kohlrabi holds together well, adding its own natural sweetness.

name: Pasta with halloumi and red onion
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: A really easy pasta recipe for when you need a satisfying dinner in a hurry.

name: Petalberry jam
ingredients: 1 food-grade scented rose, separated into petals
description: Fresh rose petals and a dash of rosewater add a delicate flowery flavour to this strawberry jam. Make sure you buy organic roses.

name: Paul’s mum’s jam tarts
description: This ‘incredibly difficult’ recipe was sent in by my mum. You can use any jam in the tarts, whichever suits your taste buds best. Top tip from my mum: it’s a good way to use up leftover pastry. I hope I do you proud mum!

name: Fat rascals
description: Baking a batch of fruity little scones for tea is really easy... though maybe less so if you rope in the little ones!

name: Pad Thai
description: Rice noodles are a fantastic storecupboard ingredient and I regularly stock up at Asian markets where you can also buy jumbo-sized bottles of staples like fish sauce, soy sauce, and so much more. This dish is possibly one of the most famous Thai dishes and appears on menus throughout the world. Rightfully so, it’s a speedy dish full of deep layers of sweet and aromatic flavours.

name: Asparagus, pea, feta and mint salad
description: Fresh spring flavours combine in this tasty side salad that deserves to be eaten outside in the sunshine.

name: Chilli and lemongrass chicken
ingredients: small handful fresh mint, basil and coriander leaves, to garnish
description: A sweetly spicy Thai dish of chicken in a thick, fragrant sauce. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Curranty cordial
description: This deliciously fruit cordial is made with redcurrants, blackcurrants and strawberries. Great diluted with water or added to cocktails.

name: Panzanella
description: The star of this show is the tomatoes. So try to find a good, ripe selection of as many shapes,  sizes and colours as you can.

name: Stir-fried corn and chilli
description: Use the kernels from fresh sweetcorn - or else frozen corn to save time - for this simple side dish. You could replace the red chillies with chopped bell pepper to make this more suitable for young kids.

name: Spicy crab cakes
description: Grated beetroot, coriander, spices and desiccated coconut combine with tinned crabmeat to make this stunner of a recipe.

name: Braised lamb shank with bay and borlotti beans
description: Borlotti beans flavoured with lemon syrup and merguez sausages makes an unusual side dish to go with braised lamb shanks.

name: Redcurrant and mint jelly
description: The combination of redcurrants and fresh mint makes this the perfect condiment to serve with lamb. Use it to add depth to gravy too.

name: Blueberry butter
description: Apple butter is a classic American preserve of slow cooked puréed apples – it’s a great way to use up a glut of apples. This version adds blueberries for a change.

name: Spiced oat cookies
ingredients: 75g/3oz baking spread, plus extra for greasing
description: At last! A sugar-free cookie! Tender, oaty and gently spiced, you'll never miss the sugar.

name: Asian-style tofu stir fry with soy, chilli and honey
Cumin and yoghurt chicken with cucumber and dill salad
ingredients: 2 large tbsp chopped dill (mint or coriander
sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
