description: A yoghurt marinade keeps this bird juicy and tender. Opening out the chicken reduces the cooking time for a quick roast.

name: Chocolate fondue with fruit platter
ingredients: selection of fruits cut in bite-sized pieces such as orange, banana, grapes, dates or pineapple
description: Feast on this gloriously simple chocolate fondue.

name: Gooseberry cupcakes
description: Flavoured with gooseberries and elderflower cordial, these summery little cakes are very similar to French friands.

name: Thai green prawn curry
description: This dish is called Leeli Kolmi Ni in Thailand.

name: Savoury pies with Jarlsberg cheese and ham (Norwegian pierogi)
ingredients: 1 egg, beaten, for glazing and sealing
description: Every country has something like these little pies – Polish pierogi, Indian samosas, Spanish and Argentinian empanadas – and this is Norway's version, made with Jarlsberg cheese and caraway seeds for that special Norwegian flavour. We give these dix points! If you're a lazybones you could use puff pastry, but you'll end up with something that's more like a fried pasty. Try these as a great little starter or beer blotter.

name: Cherry cake
description: A lovely cherry sponge cake with a little extra texture from the ground almonds. Dusting the cherries with flour helps stop them sinking to the bottom of the cake.

name: Seashell caramels
description: These pretty dark chocolate shells are filled with caramel and sealed with a white chocolate base.

name: Popcorn espresso macchiato balls
description: Stonkingly moreish, these popcorn balls are squidged together with marshmallow and blessed with a liberal sprinkling of crunchy, ground espresso coffee.

name: English almond butter toffee
description: Almond butter toffee is, without question, the George Clooney of toffees.

name: Gin and lime truffles
description: Chocolate truffles are deliciously luxurious, easy to make and made even more tempting by a dash of gin and lime.

name: Mary’s florentines
description: Try making these chewy, luxurious biscuits at home. Careful weighing of the ingredients is the key to success.

name: 3D biscuits
ingredients: ready-to-roll icing, in colours of your choice, to decorate the biscuits
description: Simple 3D iced biscuits inspired by Bake Off. Ours are less intricate than the contestants’ creations, but just as impressive and much easier to make! You can use whatever cutters you have available – or even try a freehand creation.

name: Maple bacon lollies
description: Crunchy sugar syrup lollies loaded with pecans and a sprinkling of crispy bacon bits. Sounds odd? Bacon tastes good in anything.

name: Pulled butter toffee
description: Traditional, rich and creamy butter toffee is easier to make than you might think.

name: Sherbet dipper
ingredients: 1 tsp powdered citric acid (from the chemist)
description: For a super sweet treat, share out these lemon lollies dipped in homemade zingy lemon sherbet.

name: Coffee walnut whips
ingredients: ½ tbsp soft light brown sugar
description: This homemade version of the walnut whip has a gooey coffee filling.

name: Buttered Brazils
description: Sweet toffee makes a great alternative to the usual chocolate Brazils in this easy recipe. Best eaten a day or two after making when the toffee has softened a little.

name: Rose and pistachio Turkish delight
description: Delicately floral and nutty, Turkish delight makes an original homemade gift for friends and family. Be warned though - you will need to stir the mixture by hand for an hour.

name: Salt liquorice caramels
description: Tangy liquorice gives these salted caramels a quirky edge. The caramels only take 30 minutes to make but need to set overnight.

name: Rosehip iced gem meringues
description: This is a rather sophisticated version of that childhood favourite - iced gem stars. Flavoured with rosehip syrup and crystallised rose petals, it’s all held together with a dab of white chocolate.

name: Perfect apple pie
description: Perfect your pastry to the Bikers’ standard with this delicious recipe for apple pie.

name: Deep-filled homity pie
ingredients: flaked sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Rich wholemeal pastry packed with a potato, onion and cheese filling. We’ve added spinach and a hint of nutmeg for a Biker twist.

name: Tiramisu cake
description: Like Mary Berry herself, this version of tiramisu is elegant, generous and very sweet.

name: Plum leather belts
description: Fruit leather makes a great lunchbox treat, try using different fruits throughout the seasons.

name: Gingerbread latte fudge
description: The comfort and spice of gingerbread, folded into a smooth fudge along with cream and coffee, then decorated with a frothy marbled topping.

name: Cherry chapel hat pegs
ingredients: about ¼ bottle kirsch cherry liqueur
description: These ganache-rich, liqueur-soaked cherry chocolates will have friends and family swooning in delight.

name: Pear and ginger coins
description: This simple, old-fashioned treat is an ideal snack to take on a country walk, a visit to the beach or even just a trip to the park. The pears should be firm, but ripe.

name: Cinder toffee
description: Whether it’s ‘cinder toffee’, ‘honeycomb’, ‘puff candy’ or ‘sea foam’, whatever you call it, this toffee is by far the most dramatic to make. Take care as it bubbles up like a volcano to the top of your pan while being heated.

name: Lemon and blueberry nougat
description: This is a white nougat similar to torrone. It's laden with candied peel and blueberries, chewy rather than hard, with a crisp rice-paper base.

name: Mini pear pies
description: This recipe turns the fruit tart on its head with stunning results. You can flavour the syrup with whatever spices you like.

name: Prinsesstårta
description: This Swedish layer cake is great fun - bright green and full of custard, jam, marzipan, and a mound of whipped cream!

name: Sage and onion tear and share bread
description: Tear and share these delicious sage and onion bread rolls - a perfect accompaniment to a warming soup.

name: Great sausage casserole
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: The Hairy Bikers’ take on sausage and beans makes a wonderfully warming and filling dish, and it freezes brilliantly.

name: Wilted red cabbage with ham hock
description: An easy way to turn leftover ham into a healthy meal. Homemade mayonnaise on red cabbage with no cooking needed.

name: Creamy salmon pasta bake
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Tinned salmon makes this tasty pasta bake recipe economical as well as easy.

name: No-churn lemon yoghurt ice cream
description: This is a light and refreshing lemon ice cream that you can make without an ice cream maker. Try freezing in ramekins or glasses and top with raspberries and a dusting of icing sugar.

name: Chocolate marshmallow brown sugar fudge
description: Make this recipe for delicious, creamy fudge with very little fuss (and no sugar thermometers).

name: Sun-dried tomato and olive bread
description: A savoury, salty Mediterranean sun-dried tomato loaf that makes a great sandwich with peppery rocket and ham.

name: Kouign amann
description: We have France to thank for these caramelised buttery, sugary parcels. Perfect with a café au lait.

name: Basic braised mince
description: This easy braised mince can be used as a base for lots of recipes and makes enough to freeze half for a quick supper.

name: Cabbage with mustard seeds
description: If you're looking for a healthy side dish for a curry night, try adding spice to the humble cabbage.

name: Cumberland sausage with red wine, rosemary and lentils
ingredients: 225g/8oz Italian Umbrian lentils or Puy lentils

name: Beef stroganoff with matchstick potatoes
ingredients: 450g/1lb floury potatoes, such as Maris Piper, peeled
description: Rick Stein cooks up a classic Russian beef stroganoff recipe, and reveals his incredibly moreish matchstick potatoes.

name: Gluten-free Venetian carrot cake
description: I long thought that carrot cake was an American invention, until I found out that an early version was made by Venetian Jews in the original ghetto. This modest disc is not much to look at - apart from a glorious golden-ness - but it is divine to eat. Only those with less austere eating habits will care to dollop alongside each damply crumbling wedge of cake my Italianate nod to the American cream-cheese frosting – a soft, rum-flavoured mascarpone cream.

name: Devil’s food cake
description: Forget the name, this cake is heavenly. The crumb is tender, the filling and frosting luscious.

name: Chocolate peanut butter cheesecake
description: I feel a bit apologetic for the overindulgent vulgarity that is this cheesecake here. But, really, why should I be sorry? You won’t be once you’ve eaten it; though perhaps I should warn that it’s not for the faint-hearted. Unashamed indulgence, wallowingly so, is what this recipe is all about.

name: Strawberry and almond crumble
description: This is a crumble of dreams. This is nothing short of alchemy: you take the vilest, crunchiest supermarket strawberries, top them with an almondy, buttery rubble, bake and turn them on a cold day into the taste of English summer. Naturally, serve with lashings of cream: I regard this is as obligatory, not optional.

name: No-fuss fruit tart
description: This is perhaps one of the most useful puddings you can have in your repertoire. There is pitifully little work to be done to make this berry-dazzler of a tart, and enormous pleasure to be derived from its consumption. You will need one fluted, loose-bottomed tart tin approximately 25cm/10in in diameter and 5cm/2in deep.

name: Lamb, olive and caramelised onion tagine
description: Like all stews, this benefits from being cooked in advance, so it makes sense to cook this on a day when you've got time and reheat it when you're in more of a hurry.

name: Chorizo and chickpea stew
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This is a full-on feast thrown together to enormous effect, simply with ingredients that you can more or less keep on permanent standby. And, like so many of these recipes, it’s pretty well instant. After all, if you haven’t got time to shop, it’s hardly likely you’ll be able to spend many hours at the cooker.

name: Speculaas biscuits (traditional continental Christmas biscuits)
description: Bake these spiced Christmas biscuits as edible tree decorations, homemade gifts or simply for a Christmas treat.

name: Sour cherry and stem ginger florentines
description: This quick and easy recipe for chewy, sticky florentines is absolutely foolproof. Whip up a batch for a party or make as edible Christmas gifts.

name: Homemade jaffa cakes
description: Simon Rimmer's recipe for homemade jaffa cakes is well worth the effort.

name: Lemon layer cake
description: Simon Rimmer scores a lemony hat-trick with this delectable lemon sponge soaked in lemon icing and filled with lemon cream.

name: Mulled wine trifle
description: This indulgent trifle would make an impressive Christmas dessert.

name: Toffee apple sponge pudding
description: A perfect end to an autumn dinner party, these easy steamed puddings are rich with toffee and apples.

name: Lemon and lime pavlova
ingredients: 3 free-range eggs, plus 5 free-range egg yolks
description: End your meal on a high note with this citrus centrepiece topped with tangy passion fruit.

name: Coronation prawn vol-au-vents
ingredients: 1 free-range egg, beaten, plus 1 free-range egg yolk
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Fill pastry cases with prawns and a classic Coronation sauce, for a quick-as-a-flash canapé.

name: Broad bean and courgette pilaf
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Savour the summer until every pod is popped with this delicious broad bean recipe.

name: Griddled artichoke and red onion paella
ingredients: 125ml/4fl oz good quality extra virgin olive oil
description: An easy vegetarian paella recipe. Try using it as a template and substituting your favourite seasonal vegetables.

name: Raspberry, peach and almond tart
ingredients: 4 firm, ripe peaches, cut in half, stones removed

name: Barbecued sirloin with chimichurri sauce
ingredients: 2 large handfuls finely chopped curly-leaved parsley

name: Rioja-braised lamb shanks with chorizo and garlic
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
350ml/12fl oz Rioja or 350ml/12fl oz good-quality beef stock
description: Once the initial faff of browning the meat is done, this dish requires very little effort and the resulting flavours are intense.

name: Povitica
description: Pronounced Pov-e-Tee-za, this Eastern European sweet bread is traditionally served at Christmas, but makes a delicious tea time treat at any time of the year.

name: Pappardelle with slow-cooked beef and mushrooms
ingredients: 700ml/1¼ pints hot water or beef stock
salt and freshly ground black pepper
400g/14oz vine-ripened tomatoes, each cut into eight wedges
salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Black banana cake
description: Want to know how to use up overripe bananas? Nigel Slater’s banana bread recipe is just the ticket.

name: Caldo verde (Portuguese cabbage soup)
ingredients: 1.5 litres/2 pints 13fl oz good vegetable or chicken stock
salt and freshly ground black pepper
large bunch of greens or cabbage
description: Cabbage soup doesn't need to be boring. Spice it up with smoky chorizo and comforting potatoes.

name: Chicken paprika
description: Soured cream makes this tasty one pot rich and creamy. It’s delicious served with mash or rice.

name: Schichttorte
description: This German 20-layer cake is cooked under the grill with the most watchful of eyes - namely, Paul Hollywood's!

name: Cheat’s chocolate tart
description: The pastry is the only part of this rich, chocolate tart that needs baking, making it perfect to prepare ahead for a dinner party.

name: Pulled beef brisket in a milk bun
ingredients: 200ml/7fl oz cooking juices from the beef brisket (see above) or beef gravy
description: Tom Kerridge calls this beef version of pulled pork the ‘ultimate sandwich’. It may take a while, but it will be worth the wait. Serve with coleslaw.

name: Mini coffee and walnut cakes
description: Small, but perfectly formed, this modern take on a retro classic is perfect for elevenses.

name: Mini Victoria sponge cakes
description: We’ve zapped the classic Mary Berry Victoria sponge with a shrink ray to make these adorable little cakes.

name: Carrot cake muffins
description: You can have all the same flavours and carrot cake in a muffin, plus the sweet cream cheese icing as a surprise filling.

name: Neopolitan baked Alaska
description: Three really is the magic number when it comes to ice cream and when it's finished with a prettily tinted meringue who can resist?

name: Individual lemon tartlets
description: Good things come in small packages - like these delicate little lemon tartlets. Tea, please!

name: Roquefort and walnut loaf
ingredients: 1 free-range egg, beaten for egg wash
description: Try this cheesy loaf as an alternative to crackers with a cheese board, or, just as nice, smeared with butter.

name: Sun-dried tomato and poppy seed savoury biscuits
description: A selection of savoury, buttery biscuits is just what’s needed at your next drinks party.

name: Blackcurrant and liquorice Swiss roll
description: Inspired by Japanese deco rolls, Paul uses different coloured cake batters to make a patterned Swiss roll.

name: Chocolate volcanoes
description: Paul's version of the classic chocolate fondant is all about timing. Don’t let the puddings bake to the point that their surface begins to crack, as this means the centres are starting to cook.

name: Beef and blue cheese puff pastry pizza
ingredients: 75g/2¾oz soft blue cheese, such as Dolcelatte
description: Ready-made puff pastry is a great ‘cheat’ for pizza. Topped with rich beef, a creamy cheese sauce and tangy onions, this version is hard to beat.

name: Chestnut, roasted  butternut squash and Bramley apple soup
ingredients: 2 litres/3½ pints hot chicken or vegetable stock
salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This hearty, rib-sticking soup welcomes all sorts of Christmas leftovers and brings out the best in them.

name: Toffee apple muffins
description: These delicious muffins take no time to make and are perfect for baking with children.

name: Lemon and raspberry éclairs
description: Can’t decide which is your favourite? Better have one of each then.

name: Chocolate orange tart
description: Mary's chocolatey custard tart is marbled with a pretty orange-flavoured white chocolate topping.

name: Dobos torte
description: Mary’s twist on this Hungarian cake has a full twelve layers in two tiers and is covered in caramel buttercream.

name: Sausage, pumpkin and sage casserole
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This comforting sausage casserole is the perfect Bonfire night recipe to warm you up on a sparkling night.

name: Chocolate and cherry loaf

name: Lentil curry
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: This tasty vegetarian curry is on the table in 15 minutes, perfect for a speedy weekday summer.

name: Crisp paprika chicken on chorizo rice
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper
description: Chicken and chorizo is a great combination, add some paprika to the mix and you're on to a winner.

name: Broccoli and salmon bake
description: Not sure what to cook for yourself tonight? Treat yourself to this creamy fish bake, perfect with a chilled glass of white wine.

name: Bruno Loubet’s bean and vegetable chilli
description: The list of ingredients here may look long and daunting but I promise you, the recipe is very simple – a one-pot wonder. This recipe was kindly given to me by a great chef – Bruno Loubet – who worked with me for many years. Risking Bruno’s wrath, I made a few changes to the recipe. I hope he will forgive my boldness and see the wisdom of an older man.

name: Carrot, cumin and barley summer stew
ingredients: 1 corn cob, cooked in boiling water for 20 minutes, covered
description: For many years I’ve had a deep longing to create a form of risotto using barley, but as the Italians might tell me off, I decided to play safe and call this a stew. The spices add complex notes, but the heat should be gentle. The dish is wholesome, satisfying and healthy yet luxuriously creamy and a fantastic showcase for the big flavour of my favourite Early Nantes carrots.
